trend_summary: Across the image sequence, forest remains dominant while fields expand and contract cyclically. The most visible shifts are agricultural: new clear-cut blocks appear centrally and southeast, some older fields revert to grass or young woodland, and crop mosaics rotate yearly. Built structures stay scattered and few, indicating stable, low-intensity rural land use.
notable_changes: Central block of forest cleared, forming a new rectangular harvest site in later years.
South-eastern corner shows enlargement of light-colored cropland and pasture.
Several northern and western fields shrink or are abandoned, showing early-stage tree regrowth.
Field pattern in southwest alternates between dark crops and fallow, indicating crop rotation.
Built footprint (isolated farmsteads and access roads) remains virtually unchanged throughout.
